sect2.title: Introduction to libmikmod
sect2.para: libmikmod is a sound library capable of playing audio samples as well as tracker modules. Supported module formats include MOD, S3M, XM, IT, MED, MTM and 669.

sect2.title: Installation of libmikmod
sect2.para: Install libmikmod by running the following commands:

userinput.command: sed -i -e "s/VERSION=10/VERSION=11/" \ -e "s/sys_asoundlib/alsa_asoundlib/" \ -e "s/snd_cards/snd_card_load/g" \ -e "s|sys/asoundlib.h|alsa/asoundlib.h|g" \ configure.in && autoconf && ./configure --prefix=/usr && make && make install && chmod 755 /usr/lib/libmikmod.so.2.0.4

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: sed -i -e ...: This increments the package micro version and also modifies the ALSA header search routine so that the package properly discovers the ALSA library.
autoconf: This generates a new configure script, required because of the changes to configure.in.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The libmikmod package contains libmikmod-config and the libmikmod library.

sect3.title: libmikmod-config
sect3.para: libmikmod-config provides version information, compiler and linker flags to programs that utilize libmikmod.

sect3.title: libmikmod
sect3.para: libmikmod provides the functionality that is required to play various tracker module files.
